alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 8:07PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Albany County through 845 PM MDT... At 806 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium to Cherokee Park. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, brief heavy rain and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Laramie and University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium around 810 PM MDT. Vedauwoo, Vedauwoo Campground and The Buttes around 830 PM MDT. Baldy Peak around 835 PM MDT. Yellow Pine Campground and Tie City Campground around 840 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 315 and 334. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
